website_summaries.verdict: Don't be fooled by its small stature: the Epson Expression Home XP-420 all-in-one inkjet printer forges ahead of the competition with its compact footprint, cloud connectivity options and its ability to print high-quality snapshots directly from an Android phone or iPhone.
pros: Supports a full suite of connectivity options including Wi-Fi and cloud printing services from Apple and Google, fast print speeds and excellent output quality

customer_reviews.title: All I have to say is that while some say the photos print good, I'm finding the photos to be pretty much ...
customer_reviews.text: There's plenty of reviews covering features, etc. All I have to say is that while some say the photos print good, I'm finding the photos to be pretty much worthless, if you want a quality reproduction. Fortunately, I didn't purchase this expecting to print good photos anyway. I've uploaded the original picture, then a scan of the printed one. The scan is a fairly close representation to how the print came out. It is washed out out. I scanned it at a high resolution to try to catch all the detail that I could.
customer_reviews.author: 56_Kruiser

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!! THE WORLDS WORST PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this piece of junk 0 stars I would, Reasons.... 1. poor print quality 2. Printer jams constantly 3. Needs 4 separate ink cartridges 4. When one ink cartridge runs out the whole printer stops working until you change the cartridge! 5. Tiny little ink cartridges, mean you need to buy more ink constantly!! 6. Printer constantly looses the connection with wifi. 7. A good portion of the time the device you are using cant find the printer. Enough Said.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 3 Princesses & a Prince

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the worst printer ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Printed 9 pages of a Powerpoint presentation and had to buy new ink cartridges. Paid $43.00 for new cartridges and after 8 pages all three color inks were out. A cost of nearly $5 a page. Had the same 17 pages professionally printed and bound for less. Either it uses an unreasonably large amount of ink or the cartridges are too small. Cost-per-page is too high. TERRIBLE VALUE. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: HTD

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL printer/scanner...cannot get it to scan to the pc. Several people have tried to get it to work and it will not. Unfortunately I am past my return window with Amazon. The printer worked for 4 pdfs and when I tried to print an email, it would not work. It is horrible with horrible support information. The troubleshooting either suggests making sure it is "turned on" or asks a question that I do not understand. So very frustrating...DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Big disapointment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2016 for home use. It was such a pain to use that it just sort of sat on my desk. It was way more efficient to use my husband's brother for scanning, despite his office being on another floor. I tried using it last week and it made a screeching sound. There was no paper jam. Fairly new ink cartridge. It just would screech and neither print nor scan. A piece of junk headed for the landfill. Shame. My husband has had his Brother printer/ scanner for 10 years and there's never been a problem. :-/
customer_reviews.author: JDavis

customer_reviews.title: Complete and utter crap, never buying epson ever again
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for maybe 2-3 months where it was working fine for light prints. Then it started getting streaky, not printing blacks accurately and other colors were misaligned, etc. It's gotten worse over the years, but this thing broke after like 2 months. Avoid like the plague. I see now there's other people with this same issue, and I guess I was naive to think I could fix it and hold onto this waste of office space for so many years. I recommend avoiding epson, it seems like they have planned obsolescence as a design feature.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hagood

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE JUNK. EXPENSIVE INK. STOPPED WORKING.
customer_reviews.text: All fine and dandy at first. I didn't even print much. Just some stuff for school every now and then. 6 months into owning thing POS it rank out of ink. I bought GENUINE epson ink. The black ink read FULL and yet it wouldn't print black.It would just mix all the other colors to make the color black instead. One day it just stopped working. I would print and it would be blank. Did the auto clean / self clean functions. Nothing Took it apart, cleaned the nozzle heads, wiped some excess ink I saw on a rubber part next to the sponge. NOTHING. Threw it out into the garbage and bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Niam Leeson

customer_reviews.title: Wastes a ton of ink
customer_reviews.text: This printer is horrible. I feel like I constantly have to buy ink even if I haven’t used it much, like maybe the ink dries up just sitting there unused. If I go a week or so without printing anything the documents print horribly. Blurry and faint. Have to do multiple head cleanings and alignments to get it to print decently and waste a ton of ink, when it already goes through expensive ink super quickly. It’s really junk. It’s definitely easy to set up and use wirelessly. But the print quality and ink consumption is infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Spinniken

customer_reviews.title: Lousy print head
customer_reviews.text: I have this printer for 2.5 years. It worked great until the end of the 2nd year. I stopped using it for about 6 months and the printer ink cartridge started experiencing a lot of problems. Especially the black ink. Also, it keeps saying that there's no ink left when we didn't even use the ink for many months. I've spent a lot of money buying new cartridges only to see that it's depleting really fast. It's ridiculous. I'm not spending any more money on this junk. And the nearest epson store is too far away. It's not worth it. The scanning function is fine though. I'll just use it as a scanner from now on.
customer_reviews.author: C Z

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Every 3-4 days I have to do a head cleaning to get it to print correctly. On top of that, it blows through ink like crazy. I only ever print black (shipping labels) yet it still uses color too. Even when I switch to grayscale, it uses color ink. I shouldn't need to replace color cartridges every 6 months when I am only printing in black, and if you run out of a color, it absolutely will not print. Even when I don't need that color. It is a serious pain.
customer_reviews.author: ACrow

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage!
customer_reviews.text: If I could do zero stars, I would have done it. This thing is a complete piece of garbage. I need to print something maybe once every three weeks and the second time I ever tried to print with this printer, all I got was a bunch of streaks on the page. I've done the head cleaning, head alignments, taken out the cartridges and everything else imaginable to no avail. You should definitely look for a different printer if you're looking for something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage meant to trick you into buying ink you don't need
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst printers I have ever owned. Has never printed 2 consecutive pages correctly. Blew through an entire black ink cartridge in less than 50 pages printed. Wifi set up is useless. Constantly needs to unplugged and re-plugged to get computers to recognize it. Slow as molasses in winter to scan. Basically a $100 paperweight. Update 3/1/2017 Still criminally bad, I've printed less than 100 pages in 2 years and have replaced the ink twice and the printer tells me I am out of all of my ink. It is obscene how bad this printer is. I would have replaced it already, but I only need to print once or twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: Rupreckt

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked for only a few months and we did not use it daily....or even weekly. Printing is blurry or it just doesn't print anything at all--no matter how many times I prep the ink cartridges, clean the heads or replace the ink cartridges. It is hard to read the buttons which are on the side. Don't waste your money. Had an HP before this and loved it for photos, scans and copies.....I am lucky to get a copy from this one. It is going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: SmarTGurl

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer - Ink Included
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday. Very easy to set up this wireless printer. Easy to use and was set up within 10 mins. My phone (iPhone) automatically set pulled it up as a remote printer so no additional steps were needed for that.. I will mention that this printer comes with ink so don't buy additional ink like I did. The quality of the print is as good as any I've ever had. I found that a single page prints with 15-20secs so pretty quick. I feel this was a good. It for me and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda G.

customer_reviews.title: total crap
customer_reviews.text: I have own this for a while. The printer is crap. I print in-frequently. 1. Every time I start printing after a while, it needs me to clean heads SEVERAL TIMES. Takes about 10 rounds of head cleaning before the print outs start coming out ok. The cleaning consumes ink and so usually by the time heads are clean I'm out of ink. 2. The damned thing won't print black pages when it is out of colored ink. **** this thing.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy ! total junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of crap printer !! Do not buy it. I have refiled several times with good epson ink and with others and it just runs out of ink after less than 10 prints it seems. Just changed the cartridge and got two documents printed then it was bad again. It doesn't run out it just blurs everything. I've done all the maintenance cleaned the head and all that stuff. Bottom line is the thing is garbage !
customer_reviews.author: Twebbs

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I HATE THIS PRINTER. Ninety-five percent of the time when I hit PRINT, there’s a problem. The ink runs out fast, and if one color needs replacing, it won’t even print black. Nothing but a headache and source of tearful frustration, especially when something urgently needs printing. The only thing that stops me from getting a new printer is all the cartridges I still have.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not economical .
customer_reviews.text: Epson XP-420 and XP series are using too much ink. I was only able to print 20 pages or less and had to replace ink cartridges already. I would not advise buying this unless you are only using it for copying and scanning. I couldn't understand why the EPSON printer was so reasonably priced, now we know why. The ink cartridges must be replaced often and you make up in costs what you thought you were saving. I do not recommend. Keep your old slower printer-it's worth it. I wish I could go back to the charity I donated my printer to, and bring it home again.
customer_reviews.author: VBay

customer_reviews.title: Poor combination printer; not worth the cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Awful combination home printer/scanner. The ink gets used up incredibly fast. The inexpensive cost of this unit is quickly bypassed by needing to replace the ink cartridges every 3 months for LIGHT printing and the print quality was poor to begin with. The scanner does not scan as well as a standalone epson scanner either. I would never recommend this product to anyone given my experiences above and I've been in information technology for 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected to WIFI
customer_reviews.text: This printer makes me crazy. It does a fine job of printing once it finally prints, but will not stay connected to our wifi network. While it's on, we'll get printing errors saying it's offline (when it's not offline and it says it's connected to wifi). Then you have to manually unplug it and plug it back in to get it to work (most of the time this only takes once or twice to get it to work). It's very frustrating. I just want a printer that I hook up and it works every time.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: I bought this printer for $49.00 on November 25, 2015
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for $49.00 on November 25, 2015 today is September 10, 2020 and it is still going strong. The cartridges are cheap also. This printer is value at $459 today. Even used is $339.99. I think I'll keep mine. lol Great product. Never had any trouble at all except I have dropped it several times but it still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Whitaker Spight

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually shocked by what you get for the price. I purchased this Epson last Friday via Prime and it arrived mid-Sunday which was nice. The setup is quite easy and I really like the wireless aspect of it. Although I don't do a lot of printing, I did print out a few test-photos, and they looked great. I mainly bought this as a scanner, and am very impressed with the multitude of scanning options! Scanning in the Auto-mode produces surprisingly good and fast results. Also, this unit is actually quieter than I expected, after reading some of the reviews before purchase. It's also very light and compact. Great, so far... I'll update this, if any issues arise...
customer_reviews.author: PDP

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but headaches.  Completely died in less than 2 years.  Replaced with HP Envy 4520 which is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Owned this printer for 2 years and it was nothing but trouble. Would regularly have to unplug and replug it in to get it to connect to my computer wirelessly. It now will not print at all. I called customer support multiple times, did the head cleaning multiple times, and still cannot get it print properly. Customer support said that printer is defective, but that it is no longer under warranty. Having to deal with 4 cartridges instead of 1 or 2 is also a big pain. Avoid this printer. We replaced it with an HP Envy 4520 and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Black ink clogs, unable to print
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer a little over a year ago. Over time, I began to have to clean the heads more and more frequently, as my print jobs would get lines in them. Later noticed that black ink wouldn't print at all. Now I can't print in black without without manually cleaning with nail polish remover, and even then, I can't get a good quality print. My only solution is the option to create composite black using the other colors. I did a search to find that lots of people have this problem. It's clearly a recurring issue with this printer. My advice: pay a little extra to get a more reliable machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL PRODUCT!!!!!!!!! Had it awhile, but only used it once because the wifi connection NEVER worked. (Even though everything else in our house is connected and works) Now, just moved and tried it again, wifi works but the black ink just stopped working. Cleaning manually and machine doesn't help. Putting in new ink doesn't work. Even tried downloading new drivers, nothing. Insanely disappointed. And funny thing is, the price has gone up. TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hultman

customer_reviews.title: Okay; just not great.
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have about this unit is really about Epson itself. They use to have print heads which were easily replaceable. With their change to a semi-permanent head not only is it very hard to be cleaned but unless one is extremely carefully during the process other damage can take place. Personally I preferred the easily removed and cleaned print heads even though they had to be cleaned more often; at least it could be done by the average user and not taken to a technician. Also most technician will tell you to buy a new unit because the cost of repair is almost as much as a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bodine888

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. This review is so long overdue. Since day 1 this printer has been a complete failure for the very limited printing needs of our family. We are constantly getting blank pages (do a google search lots of people experience this). When it does print lines are missing.. it is just a complete hassle that always requires new cartridges even when it shows the ink levels full. Often new cartridges are the only way to get it to print and that lasts about a day. Dont buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Danza

customer_reviews.title: Printer head dries out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine when we were using it multiple times per week, but we stopped using it for two months while we moved and the print head completely & permanently clogged up. Despite hours worth of research & effort and purchasing all new ink cartridges, it won't un-clog. We'll have to buy a new printer. I see some people saying you can still use it as a scanner, but frankly that feature isn't high-quality or user-friendly either.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook compatible, great go to printer.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Google Chromebook and needed a cloud ready printer so based on the Q&A for this printer I learned it was compatible. I had a little bit of a struggle getting it setup, but the issue was really with my router which once replaced, setup was a breeze. Note that you need a dual band router for this to work wirelessly. While going through the setup process, Epson customer support was great and very patient. One feature I learned about through the setup process was that I can email print jobs to the printer without being connected to the WiFi network. For the price, the features and quality of the printer are way above my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Krstich

customer_reviews.title: Great little photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Just printed my first photo on the printer using premium 5x7 paper. Turned out great... suitable for framing. Since the only reason that I bought this was for photo printing I'm very happy. I just wish someone would make a photo printer which accepts multiple sizes of paper without extra features built in. I already have a laser printer with built in copy, scan and fax capabilities. I'll never use the copy and scan abilities of this printer so I'd prefer not to pay for them. This is for photos only. I can't speak to the quality of those other features. But if you're looking for a great photo printer at a reasonable cost, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother...
customer_reviews.text: Godawful since the day I installed it: 1) When scanning is initiated, it rarely recognizes the computer where I want it to store the image. 2) Erratic behavior when printing: "Turn power off and back on" followed by 3 inks not being recognized. Another off/on cycle and same 3 inks need to be replaced). I am CERTAIN one of those three is nearly full. This is not the only XP-420 I'm having problems with at this point. Bought one for a relative and they no longer trust me to make tech purchases for them. Thanks, Epson. Excellent work.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: The Printer heads clog easily, and cannot be removed to clean. Yikes.
customer_reviews.text: This printer really printed wonderfully while I had it. My black ink was running low. I replaced it the day it ran out, and it wouldn't print ink. After much research I found that epson printers often have clogging issues with the printer heads (which are not removable). Cleaning was terrible because if you use the clean printer head feature it dumps ink from each cartridge... needless to say I blew through all of my colored ink just to get black to work, and then got the black running. I printed 50 sheets and it clogged again. To no prevail I couldn't get the heads cleaned with cleaning solution, in the trash it went. I bought a Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ar

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like after only 20-25 pages it runs out of ink ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because of the positive reviews. It has a couple of negatives. Print cartridges have a very short life. Seemed like after only 20-25 pages it runs out of ink and then the printer locks up, won't print, won't scan, it becomes a boat anchor until you replace a cartridge. Doesn't matter which color, just quits printing. My old HP would print until all cartridges ran dry. We stopped using it after a couple of weeks because of this annoyance. I would not recommend because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Print cartridges only last for 10-15 pages....
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer with several apple products in my household, including: iPhones, MacBook and Mac Mini. The installation was quick and the print quality is good. I think it's a great price and gets the job done. UPDATE: After printing 15 pages of labels the printer ran out of ink. The printer behaves poorly (error messages, poor print quality) when one of the cartridges is low on ink therefore you need to replace it before printing. I have purchased a new set of cartridges and have low ink levels and I only printed 10 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Lo Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: STREAKING after 2 months' use
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this printer for 2 months and this week the printing started streaking across several lines. I have been printing with mostly black ink, and now I realize I cannot even use this printer for printing a quality professional letter or a resume. Junk worksheets are fine, but nothing I would want to pass on to anyone. The WiFi has worked well, and does work with my iPhone, and the inks have lasted well, but I am so disappointed about the streaking. I would not recommend this printer for anyone who needs to show their documents printed to anyone else! Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: A Holz

customer_reviews.title: This is a Piece of Junk, Do Not Purchase !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so sorry I bought this printer, all you have to do is read the reviews since. If one color ink runs out, it doesn't print at all. It drops the wifi connection, have to painstakingly re-enter wifi address on tiny keyboard and even then you may have to do it over and over again. I have spent hours and hours just trying to get this sorry device to work, so so so sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: James Chaffee

customer_reviews.title: Constant need for nozzle/print head cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: I print on normal printing paper, shipping labels. You know just the normal USPS black lines and letters. Honestly after I do two, the third one the lines are all messed up and the ink looks smeared. So run a nozzle check and it is all messed up. So I clean the heads. I usually have to do this more than once before the lines are no longer broken on the nozzle check. Then finally can print again two, maybe if I am lucky three labels and messed up again. Periodically too, there will be globs of ink on the paper in random places. So not only would I call this an ink hog, but just not very efficient either.
customer_reviews.author: Jynx12

customer_reviews.title: I love this little printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this little printer! I bought it on a whim when my old printer was causing me grief (for the millionth time) and I have no regrets. I mostly use it to print photos, plus the occasional document. The photo quality is great. It's a nice small size. I really didn't need anything fancy in a printer and I'm just thrilled that setup was quick and easy, wireless setup and printing is simple, scanning is simple. I can print from my phone, iPad, and computer interchangeably. Plus it tells me on all those devices what size paper I have in my printer which is so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Kolafa

customer_reviews.title: Needs to come with the correct cable to connect to your PC.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the printer itself is not bad and if it came with the correct cable to connect this to my PC it would get 5 stars. The WiFi connection on this printer is spotty at best. If you are on a stronger network, say a 5G from brighthouse, you will not be able to connect to the printer. You must go on to the base network speed and restart the printer so it will register the network. The highlight of this printer is the cheap cartridges that can be found here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Higgins

customer_reviews.title: I should've read the customer reviews.
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi model is compact, and at first, I thought, dependable, it printed okay plus it fit into my budget. However, ink cartridges have minimum capacity, you have to order frequently even if you only use printer occasionally.The worst part is if black ink is too low, IT WILL NOT PRINT! It simply STOPS! It's terrible when in the midst of project like today. I'm ready to throw it out. The new recently installed black cartridge, taken right out of the unopened packaging, would not be recognized no matter what we did. Apparently, it was ?? who knows what? I've owned a few home printers but none with this frustrating type of stubborn, expensive non performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice little printer, great bang for the buck. I'm not a photo-paper connoisseur, so don't go getting this based on my review if you expect perfect pics. I don't print photos often, but when I have, it does its job as it should. Relatively easy to set up, if a little lengthy. NOTE: Does NOT come with the USB cord to connect to your computer...would have been nice if they'd have indicated that in a more viewable area than it is found. I'd still have bought it, the cord is maybe $5? Just annoyed I couldn't use it the day I received it because I needed the stupid cable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is ok, I'm glad I made the investment because I needed a printer and it gets the job done, but it is annoying to use. There was no cable to connect to your computer, so it is all wireless (over your wifi connection) and there have been many instances of the printer disconnecting from the network. The screen on the printer itself is frustrating to use when you're re-typing the wifi password that it has forgotten :/ Also pretty cheaply made. The ink it uses also runs out really quickly. BUT - it prints, and is totally useful and I am glad that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a year
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was okay. It worked really well the first 6 months, but burns through ink rather fast. Also, you can only print, even if you want just black and white, when there is still ink left in the color cartridges. After a year the printer heads became clogged, tried cleaning through setting but nothing worked essentially making it a gigantic paperweight after 1 year. (When printer heads are clogged you get streaky pages, which don't sound terrible however when you print tickets to a game or concert the skew won't scan) I would not buy this product again but worked well for a year especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this crap!!! Wasted hours of fixing and not to mention tons of money for nothing on ink
customer_reviews.text: Don’t do it!!!!!!! Seriously don’t do it!!!! Long story short printer jams, u waste ink!!! Nozzle clogs a lot, misalignment, only uses genuine ink, waste ink like crazy, prints blanks all the time, doesn’t connect, gives u errors all the time! Save your money look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Johnny wong

customer_reviews.title: and hastily decided the "buy all three together" option for printer and ink was a good idea. Didn't think amazon would pull some
customer_reviews.text: Not a problem with the ink so much as a problem with amazon. Bought this in a "bundle". Purchased a printer from amazon, and hastily decided the "buy all three together" option for printer and ink was a good idea. Didn't think amazon would pull something like this, but the bundle included the printer, a package of colored ink for the printer, and this black ink, which I only realized when the printers original black cartridge ran out, does not in fact go with/work on the printer it was bundled with. Not only am I out of Ink, but wasted $$ on a cartridge I'll never be able to use. Read the details carefully! Amazon is not your friend!.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hutcherson

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is completely glitchy. I've only had it for a month and so far it only successfully prints one out of three times. Sometimes it says printing for 20 minutes and then spits out a half printed sheet of paper, other times it prints nothing at all and pops up an error message. Extremely frustrating. The print quality is poor when printing pictures as well. The only thing I like about it is it size. Next time I'll pay for the model with the touch screen too.
customer_reviews.author: brenda Dawson

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY SUPERB for HOME USE
customer_reviews.text: Great price ... even greater value. Comes with black and color cartridges. Un-boxed and connected it to my wifi network and google cloud print in less than 10 minutes ---without reading the directions since everything was intuitive and plug-and-play. Color and print quality is excellent. My much more expensive HP laser 6510 has never has performed as well as this little dynamo, and the 6510 requires downloading HP software and drivers ..... definitely gonna ditch the HP!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Donald

customer_reviews.title: Awful printer
customer_reviews.text: Terrible printer, printing is always off, wifi is horrible. This printer is terrible. The black ink comes out very light in color or not at all. Several times ive performed maintenance and the result is the same (I use the Epson ink). . The only thing that might be wroth it is the scanner but that's it. Would never buy this again .
customer_reviews.author: SotSak

customer_reviews.title: Crap broke after 2 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this printer for 2 yrs and it wont scan and leaves heavy lines when I print no matter what I do for maintenance. It's also the slowest thing take 15 mins to wifi print 1 page off my phone. The ink is now expensive at 49 dollars a cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: alisha

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars any day!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in Feb 2016 and it is now Apr 2020 and we havent had a single issue with this printer. We bought it for home use but i'd say we use it a little more than an average household because my wife is a lawyer and I am a project manager and we both work from home often. So based on our own experience and the fact that it is still working as if it is new, it deserves 5 stars. I only wish the ink would last a little longer but since planning ahead its in my nature, I always have ink cartidges available when needed.
customer_reviews.author: jose mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: This printer SUCKS. Not only does it fly thru ink. I put in a new cyan, printed 4 pages and it said low ink, it can't print straight. No matter what I've done , it will not pull the paper in straight. Total worthless. It was a breeze to set up and it works great with wifi, but don't print anything that must be straight. Sometimes, it can't even grab the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Mackow

customer_reviews.title: THE Versatile, Value University Student's Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a basic printer/scanner/copier, especially for a college student. I have yet to run out of ink (still using the cartridges that came with the printer), but looking at the prices of colour and black refills, I am confident that this printer won't cost more to buy new ink cartridges than to replace the entire printer. I also leave it on all the time (never have shut it off)—it is energy star; I do this to save ink by avoiding the startup clean cycles which consume ink.
customer_reviews.author: Doggo

customer_reviews.title: Compact & easy-to-use w handy Epson phone app
customer_reviews.text: Simple, compact, and gets the job done for users who are willing to sacrifice some bleeding-edge performance (photo quality, print speed) for size and economy. The print-outs look pretty good and are more than adequate for regular use -- they're just not quite state-of-the-art. The printer's wireless capabilities make it very easy to use, especially if you're upgrading from a non-Wifi printer; you can print, scan, and control the device over Wifi from either your computer or the Epson app on your phone. You can also print by sending documents to an email address, although I haven't tried this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chien

customer_reviews.title: It worked great up until this month(June 2016-I purchased March 2016)
customer_reviews.text: It worked great up until this month(June 2016-I purchased March 2016). I all of a sudden got some error code. Come to find out it had a hardware failure! I will give it 3 stars because when I called Epson they were great about Troubleshooting and determined it was bad and that they were going to send me a higher grade new printer! I, however, would not recommend purchasing the xp-420
customer_reviews.author: tina anderson

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: This printer has never worked. I was deployed when it came to the house, now it is too late for me to return it. I have tried everything that I read to try to fix it, and nothing has worked. It will not print, and when it does print the words are not legible. They're VERY light and mixed together. The ink also ran out, which doesn't make any sense considering it never printed anything. I find myself needing to print something almost every day, and now i'll have to buy a new printer. What a waste of money and time. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Molina

customer_reviews.title: Updated:  terrible, not worth buying.  Original: Mostly ok, except for one big thing
customer_reviews.text: Update: Terrible printer. Most frustrating device I've ever owned. Will not remember my wireless network so I have to re-enter the password every time I need to print something. Highly recommend not to purchase. I will stay away from Epson in the future. Original: I've had this printer almost a year. It's mostly done ok, but recently I've had issues with wireless printing from my main device. May have to replace the printer just to resolve that important issue, and I don't think I'll buy another Epson printer. This is the second one in a row that's had issues.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: No zero star option. One of the worst printers I have come across. Haven't printed a single good print since we purchased. Have spent money of two sets of cartridges though, I think it uses half a cartridge to print one page. I will probably try and return it to Epson just so that they can do some type of failure analysis to understand how such a bad product is out in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was OK for a few months...
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting pretty tired of this printer after only a few months. It was great for awhile, but now network issues are fairly constant and changing the tiny cartridge is getting to be a pain. I'm buying fairly expensive Epson replacement cartridges and it still won't recognize them at times. I cycled through the "charge cartridge" set up three times recently, getting ink on my hands before it would give the 'ok' to print. My last printer was a Canon and it was zero trouble. But I gave it away for this new one. The Epson is not a nightmare, but I spend too much time getting it to talk to the network.
customer_reviews.author: LSI

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 1-1/2 years and have to say I think it's the best printer I've ever used in my office. Not one single problem. NOT ONE. Love it :) UPDATE: BEST PRINTER... til it wasn't. It just STOPPED printing ink. It went thru the motions, but no ink. Google search: it's a known problem with Epson printers I guess. Soooo, after purchasing tons of ink to try to fix it, I had to ditch it. Sad day. But, I did use it for over 2 years and luckily I only paid $50 for it. Not bad I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Novak

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: No need to add much to what other 5-star folks have said. There is a lot of bang for your buck here: quality printing, fast enough for home office, low ink usage, and low ink price. The reason we purchased this (after going through a LOT of product reviews) stems from the fact that our Canon printer - that does a wonderful printing and scanning job - was out of ink (again) and we just could not bear spending yet another $50 for ink that does not last. "Let's see if any other low cost printer performs the same, but costs a lot less to supply." THIS is perfect. WE are happy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer had a few poor reviews but I am not having any of the problems they are talking about. Just keep in mind what you are using the printer for. It performs well and I love not having to have this thing sitting on my desk. I just hooked up all my computers wireless and don't have to worry about cables. It nice that anyone in the house can print from it from any room! I also read that if one color goes out you have to change that color before using it even if your just printing in black ink. Those this is a little odd it is not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new Epson during your 2016 "Black Thursday" sale at a really nominal price. My old Epson was heavier and sturdier than this mostly plastic printer BUT I was happily surprised that it works VERY well and that Epson updated its LCD screen on the front of the printer for much more clarity than the older model I had. (The old model was incompatible with Windows 10. By the time Epson changed the compatibility to accept Windows 10, I'd already purchased this new one.)
customer_reviews.author: Wordsmith

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed and hate this printer.
customer_reviews.text: The worst printer I have ever had. Only used it 3 times and all it does it say paper jam. The rollers just sit there and spin. Won't grab the paper. I can't use the screen, go to the main screen, print, nothing. It will not work. I have googled it, downloaded problem fixes, you tubed solutions everything and still says paper jam with no paper in it. I don't recommend getting this printer. Epson does not make good printers and customer service is of no help. Very very disappointed.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: Never again, Epson.
customer_reviews.text: Regrets? Totally filled with them. Bought in December 2015. Without a doubt the worst printer I've ever purchased. 1) Doesn't feed the paper straight and square. 2) Printing once every 2 weeks requires head cleaning at least once usually twice. 3) What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.author: D. Butikofer

customer_reviews.title: No problems for maybe a year...
customer_reviews.text: We liked it at first but then after about a year it started printing blurry all the time. We clean the nozzle heads every time we need to print now. We called customer service a couple times but they won't replace it because after troubleshooting it works again immediately after... even though we have to troubleshoot EVERY time we print something. And we are students so we print multiple things every week. Not my favorite printer...
customer_reviews.author: Allison & Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 - unable to get this to connect via wifi
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 - unable to get this to connect via WiFi. I have downloaded the software and been thru the online setup guide and all troubleshooting options. No luck. Since this printer does not come with the squared ended USB cable, I need to order one. (sigh) A bit frustrating. Why not include the $3 cable? I mean, come on........ Update: Successfully setup and printing via cable on windows 10 Laptop. Print quality is good. Like the 'black only' feature to preserve color ink Please Note: When using the Scanner, the outer edges are cut off (@ 1/4 inch) if you align the doc to be scanned with the edge of the glass
customer_reviews.author: NonnieTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable all-in-one printer with decent photo printing
customer_reviews.text: My old printer stopped working and I needed a new one quickly. This turned out to be a great find. The network connectivity was easy to set up on all my computers, and the Epson Connect features are nice, especially the ability to send an email to the printer that you want printed. I know several printers offer this, and I can't compare this one to others, but it works well with the XP-420. We didn't buy this specifically for photo printing (we usually use an online service), but the photos we have printed are good quality. We have not printed larger than 4x6 yet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. It practically sets itself up. All I had to do was enter my network password and put the disc in the PC and click 'Next' a few times. I had a lot of problems with Kodak and HP printers and I ended up buying two of these to replace them. The Android and iPhone apps make it very easy to print from anywhere. It's fast and I really like that I can replace individual color cartridges (this couldn't be done on my HP - I had to replace all of them at the same time, every time). And the cartridges are rather cheap comparatively.
customer_reviews.author: VG Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  Printer STOPS WORKING when a cartridge becomes empty!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! This printer will STOP WORKING if one of the cartridges is empty; even if all the others are FULL! I was not aware of this and read about it only after having this happen to me. The printer acts like its printing and then spits out blank pages. Apparently it's common practice for the lower end models.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gelinas

customer_reviews.title: This is a good one !
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love it. Love it. This is a really neat little printer that has worked without a glitch for a year or so. I got it for the wireless feature and to print from an iPad. It works just fine as a printer and a copier, which are all I use it for. My opinion: Epson makes great printers. They also have quite a deal on buying replacement ink from them, at a price that beats all the other sources I've found. PS: I am not connected to Epson in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: the 3 colors are nearly empty already and the black ink shows/sounds like there is ink in there
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer last fall to print out papers due for class. This printer had all of the features I wanted when reading about it, but the ink it uses is ridiculous. After just replacing the ink and printing a test page, the 3 colors are nearly empty already and the black ink shows/sounds like there is ink in there, but the printer won't print anything in black. Sucks that I'm now stuck with a useless printer taking up space in my home and am going to have to purchase another printer that actually works without wasting tons of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Biggest waste of money, never again will I buy an Epson product. Be aware that after replacing your first ink cartridges these printers have a known issue of printing blank pages. cleaning the print head does nothing to fix the issue. Don't waste your money on this POS product.
customer_reviews.author: JDG

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my HP printer/scanner/copier, and was frustrated at the software issues HP is plagued with. So I got this one. Big mistake. This item is garbage. Dead out of the box. After talking to someone overseas on tech support, we learned that it was dead. No apology. They'll send me a refurbushed one to replace it. If I wanted a refurbished one originally, I would have bought a used one on Ebay.
customer_reviews.author: David Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about 3 months when a light came on that said paper jam so we took all the paper out opened the back flap and checked it there was no paper in it but yet the light was still on and would not print so we tried unplugging it for a few mins then hours then days and still the light is on we have replaced the toner the drum and still the paper jam light so this was aweosme at first then became a paper weight weather quickly will not be buying this product again we even have the 3 year protection program but can't get it replace for some reason????
customer_reviews.author: John doe

customer_reviews.title: As depicted/Easy set-up/Phones not printing to it yet
customer_reviews.text: This printer is as depicted and the set up was pretty easy. I was able to get connected to it quickly, although I had some trouble understanding how to connect it with two smartphones. So far, I don't think I can print from the phones and can't figure out why. For me, it's a minor glitch but I'll have to troubleshoot it, I'm sure. I don't like when things don't work like they should. The printers does a good job printing text and photos. From what I can tell, the cost of the ink is less than for previous Canon and HP printers I've had, which is a plus. In all, a decent printer at a fairly good price.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Cook

customer_reviews.title: Ink doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I get 50 pages or less from each ink cartridge. And, now am getting a doesn’t recognize ink cartridge error message on a brand new Epson cartridge. Have tried every troubleshooting tip I could find, but nothing clears the error. Trying to decide if I want to buy another cartridge to try, or just get a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming shopper

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a piece of garbage. I never write reviews but this was a ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of garbage. I never write reviews but this was a waste of money and I'd hate to have someone make my mistake. I bought this printer a year ago and it has never worked right. I had to print airline tickets and they wouldn't scan at the gate since the printing wasn't precise. I had to make seating cards for my wedding and it was easier for me to paper cut each one then to align it on the printer. The ink runs out very fast even though it's cheap. I have to print notes for class and it won't even print. Just pure crap. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Great expectations, extreme let down!
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer, because I needed to print from my Apple iPhone and iPad. The first printer I found I could do this with! Problem was, I haven't even run out of my sample ink, and the printer has broken! I have never had such a bad experience with epson! Now I have things to print within twelve hours, and have absolutely no way to print them.
customer_reviews.author: DBarnmyer

customer_reviews.title: Forces you to use color cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Forces you to use color cartridges even if you just want to print black and white. I almost never print in color. I would have just bought a black and white printer if I knew this thing was going to find a way to drain color ink when I print in black and white. The software that comes with most printers sucks and this printer is no different. It works so I'm giving it 3 stars but if I buy another printer it'll be from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty133

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer.
customer_reviews.text: Second Epson wireless printer. Coupled with the inexpensive "generic" inks available on Amazon, this is a wonderful unit. Problem free connectivity, inexpensive to use, feeds everything from card stock to certificate papers, Scans and faxes perfectly. I used to be a fan of Canon printers, but these are far better for me. I use daily as a secretary for my towns Masonic Lodge. Lots of scanning and printing.
customer_reviews.author: Ross B

customer_reviews.title: after ~a dozen pages of printing, blank lines, unfixable
customer_reviews.text: I admit that I don't print often but I've printed *maybe* a dozen pages total from it (mostly just black) and it no longer works. It's skipping lines even with just black so something is wrong with the head. Manual head cleaning is messy and a waste of time. head cleaning and nozzle check functions are also waste of time and ink. new ink carts have same problem. go cheap laser instead of ink!
customer_reviews.author: j-marr

customer_reviews.title: Look at ink cost for epson Expressions Home XP-420 before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the printer with ink. Printer was a great price and works well either connected directly or via WiFi. However, the first ink cartridge (black) went dry after about 25 sheets of paper were printed. I have just had to order more ink. Before you buy, check the prices on the ink. It appears to me they could give the printers away and make their profits on the ink. I have had other epson printers and the ink cost far less. The remanufactured cartridges appear to be much better priced, but don't seem to rate very highly so I'm somewhat afraid of ordering those.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Against my better judgement I bought a new one (same printer but ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago and it worked...for a while. I think about 1 1/2 years. Then the magenta color wouldn't work so I had to buy a new printer. (i tried head cleaning, etc. nothing worked). Against my better judgement I bought a new one (same printer but slightly newer model) and...a year later I am having the same problem. Only this time its the blue (cyan) ink that stopped working. If you want a printer that will last a year and then stop working buy this. But if you want one that will last anything longer....I highly recommend you get something else. I am not happy. :(
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this printer for two years and I would expect a product to last AT LEAST that long without a lot of fuss. But don't bother with this printer. Pass, pass, pass it by! We have had nothing but trouble from the get go. It sucks black ink up like a tornado. It will begin printing blank pages even with all ink levels are full, What a joke. TWO years! Anything should last longer than two years! DO NOT waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: MRS

customer_reviews.title: Printing is excellent, using the scanner and other features are very easy to do thanks to the built-in LCD screen
customer_reviews.text: After going through more than a few sub-$100 all-in-one printers from other brands, I decided to spend a little more (limit of $150) and the Epson XP-420 fit the bill. Printing is excellent, using the scanner and other features are actually very easy to do thanks to the built-in LCD screen and controls. I only gave it 3/5 stars because it goes a little fast through inks, especially black. Other than that it's been a reliable, affordable multifunction printer worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FOR US
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised and set up in about 1 hour. Works fine but I have always used a usb connection and used that for this printer. Didn't try the wifi as we only use to print from our pc, scan and make copies for our home use. Hope it lasts as long as last Epson printer...9 yrs. Works for us and fills our needs. No comment on wifi features hence only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: But hopefully anyone reading this will spend their money on a better, more reliable product
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL!!!! If you see any reviews that say "Don't Buy" believe it. This model has a known defect which causes the nozzles to stop working after a short time. I purchased my printer 2 years and it no longer prints or copies. After buying two sets of toner packages, each at >$50 each, the printer prints and copies everything in blue. I'm troubled that Amazon continues to sell this product and at an insulting price of $165.00! But hopefully anyone reading this will spend their money on a better, more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Doryne Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ink is very expensive and does not last very long. I have had this for a year and printed very little on it so should not be worn out but today it started printing yellow in place of red. Cannot recommend it. Not at all happy with amount of money I have spent on ink. Update: Now nothing will print. Printer sends through blank pages. I guess print heads are permanently clogged. Will not buy any Epson again. Not been happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rarely works without troubleshooting
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for over a year now, so these aren't start-up or learning issues. Lots of issues with wireless connection, even though it's next to my router. Also have issues with printer not ready and printer being completely unresponsive. Most times I have to unplug the power cord to get the thing to work. I'm sure this will be my last Epson printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Newsom

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! 2 of these broke less than a year after buying
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! I wish I could give this zero starts. I have had TWO of these printers and both of them broke less than a year after having them. I only used this printer for basic black and white and occasionally used it for color printing. On both printers the ink got clogged somewhere in the printer. I tried to fix the first one myself, but it was a nightmare. NEVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Abner

customer_reviews.title: NO COLOR AFTER FIRST INK CHANGE
customer_reviews.text: 3 month after I purchased this, I changed Ink, and it will not print in color and if it does it is a orange red. Have tried to get it to work but it won't. I am not sure if it makes a difference if they are new or refilled cartridges, because I have tried both. It does no good to contact Epson. Also it sure drinks the ink. This is the worst piece of junk Epson has ever made. It is too bad Amazon sells junk like this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: it was fine; however
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it was fine; however, it was constantly breaking down and I would get on line with representative and go through the process of getting back on line. I had already return several of these printers because of this. I would not buy another Epson. Don't know why I continued to struggle with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus

customer_reviews.title: Big problem
customer_reviews.text: I tried placing the paper in several different ways (in the center, towards the right, towards the left) but when the printer itself pulls it somehow it always turns out crooked. So basically it is useless. I wish I could return it but it has been a while since I got it and I wouldn't know if this is a problem with my printer or if all of them come like this. Pretty much sucks since it cannot print properly and makes me waste ink and paper while trying to get a decent result.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Such a piece of crap. I bought this for my school work in died after 2 weeks. Then started working the printed so slow. the black ink would always come up empty even after replacing with a new one. Waste of money do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gisette

customer_reviews.title: Great to be back!
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these and my insistence on being frugal moved me to using refilled ink cartridges which after a couple of years killed it. In the interim I thought I would try a cheap HP from Walmart. Big mistake as the software sucked and it was a monster to set up. Returned in the same week purchased. Bought this one for almost the same price, was a breeze to set up, and works flawlessly. Will only use Epson ink this time and see if it outlasts my last one. Great value and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Clendening

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer. Printed 1 paper and after that it always says paper jam when there clearly is no paper in the machine, have reset the printer, taken out the ink carrtridges and resat them, ive tried updating the software everything. it continues to say paper jam and will not give me any options or access to the menu to the printer because the paper jam screen continues to stay there. There is no hope for this printer. Bad product right out of the box. STAY AWAY. Buy HP.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and eventually very expensive
customer_reviews.text: The body of the printer is light and flimsy and the double sided printing has to be manually done with each page. Overall, the the cartridges run out very quickly and are too expensive. Should not be attracted by the low price as cartridge costs will render this printer to very expensive in the recent future. Probably better to invest in a high cost printer with low overhead cartridge cost.
customer_reviews.author: Grad

customer_reviews.title: I really like this printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer, the only con is that the set up was a little tricky and confusing, from the confusing instructions that left out basic instructions on removing packing material from the inside of the printer. But as a printer, this is perfect for my small business, and home us. My kids can print form there school ipads, and the ink last longer than my Lexmark printer by far. my last printer was from 2005, and the the wireless and network printing is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: When I first bought this printer I LOVED it!
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this printer I LOVED it!!. Then it ran out of ink. No problem, I ordered what it told me to. But guess what...that's right the printer didn't recognize the new ink. So, I ordered more thinking it was just the cartridge, still didn't work. Very frustrating!! Now I have this lovely printer sitting in my house collecting dust because I can't find an ink cartridge that works. Did anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: but for someone who prints infrequently like I do
customer_reviews.text: Prints ok, but for someone who prints infrequently like I do, I find that I have to clean the print heads just about every time otherwise text comes out fuzzy. Also the cartridges don't last very long, but I'm not sure if that's because I don't use it all that often and the ink may dry out. I'm pleased with the price overall and the fact that it works with AirPrint, but I certainly wouldn't brag about it.
customer_reviews.author: Shockwave562

product_meta.title: Epson Expression Home XP-420 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner & Copier
product_meta.description: This space-saving, wireless Small-in-One prints from tablets and smartphones and features automatic scanning to Facebook and cloud services. Includes 1.44" Color LCD and built-in card slot. This Epson printer is designed for use with only genuine Epson-brand cartridges. Other brands of ink cartridges and ink supplies are not compatible and, even if described as compatible, may not function properly or at all. Epson provides information about the design of the printer on the box and in many other locations and materials included with the printer and on the website. Epson periodically provides firmware updates to address issues of security, performance, minor bug fixes and ensure the printer functions as designed. This printer was designed to work only with genuine Epson ink cartridges and some updates may affect the functionality of third party ink. Non-Epson branded or altered Epson cartridges that functioned prior to a firmware update may not continue to function.
feature_bullets: This printer is designed for use with Epson cartridges only, not third party cartridges or ink. Cartridges described as Compatible, Remanufactured, refilled or refillable may not work properly or at all. See product description for more details.
Easy setup and navigation - large, 2.5" Color LCD
Compact, space-saving design and great performance
Print from iPad, iPhone, tablets and smartphones
Individual inks - replace only the color you need
Scan to Facebook, Plus built-in card slot

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars2,098 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
